page.title: 01MADELEY STAFFS : PROLOGUE
page.content: Madeley in Staffs lies at the junction of 3 counties,Staffs,Cheshire and Shropshire.It is thus distant from the county's centre.The block being researched comprises Little & Middle Madeley & Madeley Heath & lies E of Great Madeley the Saxon settlement. Though only 8 miles E of Crewe & 10 W of the Potteries-both large industrial centres-its setting is rural.It is surrounded by softly undulating farm & wood land rising from 200 to 550 feet. The river Lea flows through the village but high above the long main street the M6 motorway carries heavy traffic.There is little industry except agriculture & few amenities.Most of the inhabitants work & seek culture elsewhere:Keele University 2 miles away offers a great deal.The only buildings of note are Park House,the 3rd Manor and the empty College campus.
